comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.created_time: November 06, 2022, 02:19:05 PMLast edit: November 07, 2022, 12:17:59 PM by Charles-Tim
comments.body: Instant exchange? Meaning that people that wants to exchange will first deposit into the addresses that you control and you can seize the coiny, which makes the scammer to be able to go away with the coins, while people that wants to exchange will lose and become a scam victim. Code:Domain:               cryptochanger.toCreated on:           Wed Aug 17 09:37:09 2022Last edited on:       Thu Aug 25 02:21:07 2022Expires on:           Thu Aug 17 09:37:09 2023Edit:The exchange domain was just registered less than 3 months ago. It is better to just still try with low amount of money until the instant exchange gain good reputation.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Quote from: cryptochanger.to on November 06, 2022, 02:05:41 PMWe achieved an average transaction speed of 5 minutes to ensure you don't waste any time.What guarantees it will keep running for 5 minutes when network traffic is high?Quote from: cryptochanger.to on November 06, 2022, 02:05:41 PMNo registrationWhat's this for?

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: Where are you located, and how can you manage to offer your services without KYC? From what I have seen, almost every instant exchange out there can ask you to verify your identity if they notice a "suspicious activity".

comments.author: cryptochanger.to
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on November 06, 2022, 02:19:05 PMInstant exchange? Meaning that people that wants to exchange will first deposit into the addresses that you control and you can seize the coiny, which makes the scammer to be able to go away with the coins, while people that wants to exchange will lose and become a scam victim. Code:Domain:               cryptochanger.toCreated on:           Wed Aug 17 09:37:09 2022Last edited on:       Thu Aug 25 02:21:07 2022Expires on:           Thu Aug 17 09:37:09 2023The exchange domain was just registered less than 3 months ago, one of the reasons it should not be used. If anyone read this, uses the exchange and got scammed, I hope such person should not regret after this warning.We have launched our exchange in the recent month, we are highly vouched on various forums online, i can't seem to understand the baseless claims you're making simply from the domain age, you can ask for our profile link on other forums to check our previous vouches but you can't draw conclusions from simply looking up a domain age.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: cryptochanger.to on November 06, 2022, 02:43:45 PMWe have launched our exchange in the recent month, we are highly vouched on various forums online, i can't seem to understand the baseless claims you're making simply from the domain age, you can ask for our profile link on other forums to check our previous vouches but you can't draw conclusions from simply looking up a domain age.Okay, agreed. But it is still new and no evidence that you have good reputation yet. But let us see how it goes. How about the login and sign up links on the website? You are regarding it as no KYC instant exchange, then why sign up and login?

Waiting for the answers.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on November 06, 2022, 02:50:23 PM You are regarding it as no KYC instant exchange, then why sign up and login?Is this question really relevant? What's wrong with asking a sign up and login and where's the connection with KYC here? If there's no KYC, you can use any mail account, any name etc. There's no rules which say if a site is claiming to be a no KYC site, it can't ask for sign up.

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on November 06, 2022, 02:50:23 PMI will only draw conclusion if they last longer than I think without any bad reputation or compromise. But my advice to anyone using this platform should be very careful with the rate of exchange they always present here because they always knows how to get users attention since people don't want to reveal their kyc details they believe it could be easier to attract and lure you into using their platform. I would prefer an exchange with kyc that are reputable to trade instead of failing prey for new platform.

comments.author: cryptochanger.to
comments.body: It's optional to SIGN UP if you want to see your previous exchanges.We never ask for any form of KYC.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Where do I get my money? Do you have a stock of coins and you send from it? If so, what are the max values per user/accout?Do you sign a letter with the address before sending, or only tx ID?What happens to the data after I log in? How are you going to make sure you won't store it?According to this QuoteWe work with various crypto trading platforms so we can find the best offer on the market for you.We all know that most of these platforms require KYC, so how will you ensure that they do not lock these platforms?

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: cryptochanger.to on November 06, 2022, 02:43:45 PMWe have launched our exchange in the recent month, we are highly vouched on various forums online, i can't seem to understand the baseless claims you're making simply from the domain age, you can ask for our profile link on other forums to check our previous vouches but you can't draw conclusions from simply looking up a domain age.What forums exactly can vouch for you, maybe you should name them if you already said something like that.Question for me is what are you going to do if someone sends you coins that are coming from previously registered hacks, or someone marked them as ''dirty''?Would you ask for any verification than, and would you freeze coins or not?I checked your website and I see that maximum amount of Bitcoin that can be exchanged is 1.5 BTC, that is not a lot of money in 2022.This is better than false showing unlimited coins like some competition websites are doing, but it's still not great.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: rat03gopoh on November 06, 2022, 02:31:22 PMWhat's this for?Although I use to exchange on some decentralized exchange before without no login, that could be confusing, I just noticed that if you check common instant exchange sites, you will see an icon for sign up and login, but likely not necessary to first sign up and login before you can be able to exchange from one coin to another unless they force you to do so. They can also later force anyone to provide KYC. Quote from: Little Mouse on November 06, 2022, 04:49:51 PMIs this question really relevant? What's wrong with asking a sign up and login and where's the connection with KYC here? If there's no KYC, you can use any mail account, any name etc. There's no rules which say if a site is claiming to be a no KYC site, it can't ask for sign up.I thought nothing like sign up and login on instant exchange before, but I noticed that is not true not quiet long. Thanks for pointing to that. I have just noticed they are called instant exchange, but no much privacy as some even give the option to sign in with social media like Facebook. I remember when I was using instant exchange on Coinomi when I still do not know much about crypto, no login but just a third party. Just a confusion because I ihave not accessed any instant exchange website for use before and it was long ago k used instant exchange last.@cryptochanger.toI will edit my post and be a bit soft, I hope you will be a good instant exchange.

comments.author: cryptochanger.to
comments.body: Quote from: dkbit98 on November 06, 2022, 09:54:41 PMQuote from: cryptochanger.to on November 06, 2022, 02:43:45 PMWe have launched our exchange in the recent month, we are highly vouched on various forums online, i can't seem to understand the baseless claims you're making simply from the domain age, you can ask for our profile link on other forums to check our previous vouches but you can't draw conclusions from simply looking up a domain age.What forums exactly can vouch for you, maybe you should name them if you already said something like that.Question for me is what are you going to do if someone sends you coins that are coming from previously registered hacks, or someone marked them as ''dirty''?Would you ask for any verification than, and would you freeze coins or not?I checked your website and I see that maximum amount of Bitcoin that can be exchanged is 1.5 BTC, that is not a lot of money in 2022.This is better than false showing unlimited coins like some competition websites are doing, but it's still not great. As i've said, we never ask for any form of KYC thus our exchange can exchange at maximum only ~1.5 BTC at the moment. Other exchanges as you said "they show unlimited coins "  we don't that, we only show what we can exchange.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: cryptochanger.to on November 06, 2022, 02:05:41 PMa new thread will be createdWe will close this threadCare to explain this and what exactly you want to accomplish here? You don't have to close this thread. You can explain your intentions and respond to members' inquiries, but I think it's clear that you want to stop people discussing issues openly. It makes it seem like you're afraid of what people might ask or say, and that's not a good way to build trust with your community.I added another neutral tag to your trust profile to alert members of this community to your suspicious behavior.

comments.author: cryptochanger.to
comments.body: Quote from: FatFork on December 16, 2022, 08:47:08 AMQuote from: cryptochanger.to on November 06, 2022, 02:05:41 PMa new thread will be createdWe will close this threadCare to explain this and what exactly you want to accomplish here? You don't have to close this thread. You can explain your intentions and respond to members' inquiries, but I think it's clear that you want to stop people discussing issues openly. It makes it seem like you're afraid of what people might ask or say, and that's not a good way to build trust with your community.I added another neutral tag to your trust profile to alert members of this community to your suspicious behavior.We are more than happy to get the feedback and that's the reason why we constantly add more features based on users recommendations, but when posts are senseless trash selling comments that have 0 proof or meaning we have to make a stop to it and that's exactly what you can see in previous posts, where users make trash selling comments just because we're a new exchange i think that can't be fair.Please check the first posts and you would understand.We tried reporting to moderators but we have got no response, that's why wanted to stop advertising our service since we can't fight baseless claims we had to close the thread.If you have any question or want to see more vouches please send us a private message so we can send you our links on other forums (i don't know if it's against TOS to mention other forums here).
